org.pojava.util

Class EncodingTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pojava.util.EncodingTool

  • public class EncodingTool
extends Object
    A class for reversible encodings. Typical encodings are designed to represent binary data in a more portable or printable format. Currently supported encodings include Base64, Hexadecimal.
    Author:
    John Pile

    • Constructor Summary

      EncodingTool()

      • base64Encode

        public static String base64Encode(byte[] src)
        Encode binary data into a Base-64 array of printable characters.
        Parameters:
        src - Binary data to encode
        Returns:
        Base-64 encoded string

      • base64Decode

        public static byte[] base64Decode(String s)
        Decode a String from Base64 format. It strips whitespace before decoding.
        Parameters:
        s - a Base64 String to be decoded.
        Returns:
        An array containing the decoded data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the input is not valid Base64 encoded data.

      • base64Decode

        public static byte[] base64Decode(char[] encoded)
        Decode a Base64 message back to its original byte array.
        Parameters:
        encoded - a character array containing the Base64 encoded data.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the decoded data.

      • hexDecode

        public static byte[] hexDecode(String hex)
        Convert a hex-encoded string back to a byte array. This String version strips whitespace before decoding.
        Parameters:
        hex - Hexadecimal string
        Returns:
        decoded array of bytes

      • hexDecode

        Convert a hex-encoded character array back to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        hexChars - array of hex-encoded characters
        Returns:
        original byte array

        Output a hex-encoded representation of a byte array
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • base2Encode

        public static String base2Encode(byte[] bytes)
        Convert a sequence of binary data into '0' and '1' characters.
        Parameters:
        bytes - binary data to encode
        Returns:
        sequence of ones and zeros representing binary values.

      • base2Decode

        public static byte[] base2Decode(char[] chars)
        Convert a sequence of '1' and '0' characters back into byte values.
        Parameters:
        chars - array of packed characters in the set [01].
        Returns:
        binary array derived from zeros and ones

      • base2Decode

        public static byte[] base2Decode(String onesAndZeros)
        Convert a sequence of '0' and '1' characters into a byte array, ignoring whitespace.
        Parameters:
        onesAndZeros - a string of [01] and whitespace characters.
        Returns:
        binary encoded version of ones and zeros packed into bytes.
